pr_title: Issue #5832: add javadoc and xdoc Example for StaticVariableName

timeline.bodyText:
we try to show examples for each property
https://checkstyle.org/config_naming.html#StaticVariableName_Properties
please extend example to use all applyXxxxxxxx
timeline.author: romani

replies.bodyText:
I add a new example to show how to configure the check with public and protected type suppressed. Can help me check if this is ok?
Also, the wercker pipeline is failing, I am not sure how it works as the page show 401......Can tell me how to read this check?
replies.author: 0blivious

replies.bodyText:
@0blivious unfortunately, wercker does not allow anonymous access like the other CIs so only the admins can view it.
It failed on Sonarqube validation but it isn't reporting an error and the direct sonar page says it passed. It looks to me like its a false error.
replies.author: rnveach

replies.bodyText:
From log of sonar build item:
Sonar API Token has no access rights
But expected is Sonar Qualitygate is OK , something wrong with token.
This failure can be ignored.
I am restarting wercker.
replies.author: romani

timeline.message: Issue #5832: add javadoc and xdoc Example for StaticVariableName

timeline.bodyText:
public and protected type

Shouldn't type be plural?
timeline.author: rnveach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -53,17 +53,57 @@ * An example of how to configure the check is: *

* 
- * <module name="StaticVariableName"/>
+ * <module name="StaticVariableName"/>
+ *
+ *

Code Example:

+ * 
+ * class MyClass {
+ *   public static int goodStatic = 2; // OK
+ *   private static int BadStatic = 2; // violation, name 'BadStatic'
+ *                                     // must match pattern '^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$'
+ * }
+ *
+ *

+ * An example of how to suppress the check to public and protected type is:

timeline.author: rnveach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -53,17 +53,57 @@ * An example of how to configure the check is: *

* 
- * <module name="StaticVariableName"/>
+ * <module name="StaticVariableName"/>
+ *
+ *

Code Example:

+ * 
+ * class MyClass {
+ *   public static int goodStatic = 2; // OK
+ *   private static int BadStatic = 2; // violation, name 'BadStatic'
+ *                                     // must match pattern '^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$'
+ * }
+ *
+ *

+ * An example of how to suppress the check to public and protected type is: + *

+ * 
+ * <module name="StaticVariableName">
+ *   <property name="applyToPublic" value="false"/>
+ *   <property name="applyToProtected" value="false"/>
+ * </module>
+ *
+ *

Code Example:

+ * 
+ * class MyClass {
+ *   public static int GoodStatic1 = 2; // OK
+ *   protected static int GoodStatic2 = 2; //OK
+ *   private static int goodStatic = 2 // OK
+ *   private static int BadStatic = 2; // violation, name 'BadStatic'
+ *                                     // must match pattern '^[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*$'
+ * }
  *
*

* An example of how to configure the check for names that begin with - * a lower case letter, followed by letters, digits, and underscores is: + * a lower case letter, followed by letters, digits, and underscores. + * Also, suppress the check from being applied to private and package-private type:
